verses.roman:
kolāhala nāhi, prabhura kichu bāhya haila
tabe nityānanda sabāra śrama jānāila

synonyms: kolāhala—tumultuous sound; nāhi—there was not; prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; kichu—some; bāhya—external consciousness; haila—there was; tabe—at that time; nityānanda—Lord Nityānanda; sabāra—of all of them; śrama—fatigue; jānāila—informed.
translation: When there was no longer a tumultuous sound, Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu returned to consciousness. Then Nityānanda Prabhu informed Him of the fatigue of the chanters and dancers.
